data.title: Fixed flag for importing animation and skipping value tracks.
data.body: Simple fix. Just makes the import flag in the Collada importer function as intended to allow you to ignore value tracks in animation.

data.title: Mouse button event.pressed not getting picked up
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10      Godot v2.2.alpha.custom_build

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I paint cubes on a ground plane with no rigid body, event.pressed can be false.  When I paint cubes on the ground plane event.pressed is never negative.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run the project.  Click on the ground and drag.   If you release the mouse event.MOUSE_BUTTON event.pressed is not false.   This is in script create_cube_on_click

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://www.dropbox.com/s/0v7mlrlngdxb3pv/game_001_pressed_bug.rar?dl=0

data.title: Rewrite the README to be more descriptive
data.body: Feedback welcome on the (arbitrary) changes :)

data.title: Rename WinRT platform to UWP
data.body:
Using the legacy name usually causes confusion, Universal Windows Platform is now the official name for it.

Note: rename the `winrt` tag here in GitHub when this is merged.

data.title: Regex module requires runtime type information
data.body: Since #6887, the Regex module included in the repository uses `dynamic_cast` in [regex.cpp](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/20dd5a62cf4b639987c62c38447ff39fe1d692c8/modules/regex/regex.cpp). This requires RTTI, which is disabled in JavaScript builds to keep the file size low.

data.title: 2D rendering optimizations for 2.x
data.body:
I'm optimizing the 2D rendering. I was aware that my work would probably never get merged due to Godot 2.2 skipped and the new renderer for 3.0 will probably be already better optimized than the current.

At least it would be of use in my currently developed game until the Godot 3.0 version compatible with GL ES 2.0 were released.

But now I know Godot 2.1.1 will see the light of the day, tomorrow probably. So there is still a chance for my work to become official and get merged in an official Godot release. Probably I'm too late for 2.1.1, but is there any hope of a 2.1.2 or 2.2 release?

Of course, first I have to complete the task (one or two days I expect) and check it the performance gain worths it (provided there is actually some gain; you never know).

Also I would like to know if people are interested in this being released.

data.title: Centered sprites are off in odd sizes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot Windows x64 v2.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When using the centered option in a sprite, it'll be half a pixel off if it's an odd sized image, e.g: 11x9. I think that's fixable since you can unmark the centered option and mess with the offset to properly center it, but it's a pain in the ass to do so when you have hundreds of images.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create an odd sized image, put it in a sprite node and mark "centered".

data.title: Directory.dir_exists() always return True on Android
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Android Galaxy S4 Galaxy S6
Godot tools and export templates from 20dd5a6 compiled on Windows 7 x64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Calling Directory.dir_exists(some_path) on Android always return True even if there isn't any directory in that path
Related to [6837](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6837)

**Steps to reproduce:**
A project with assets:
- scenes
    - 0
        - 0.scn
        - 1.scn
        - 2.scn
        - 3.scn

And the following code
```
1. var dir = Directory.new()
2. var path = "res://scenes/non_valid/dir"
3. if dir.dir_exists(path):
4. 	print(path, " exist")
5. else:
6. 	print(path, " not exist")
```
After running this on Android device it will print "res://scenes/non_valid/dir exist" even if it isn't.

data.title: Changing type of node removes it from all groups
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1, but pretty positive the issue is there in 2.2+

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If a scene was added to a group in the Node viewer (Node is next to Inspector. Group is next to Signals)
and then we try to change the type of the scene (say, static 2d to area2d), the added "Group" is gone! 

Looking for issues in the wrong place, this can lead to headaches if overlooked, barking up the wrong tree is not nice!

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a scene lets say StaticBody2D
Add it to a group, lets say "Walls"
Change the type of the Scene/Node to Area2D
Grouping is gone.

data.title: Automatic behavior testing
data.body:
[I posted this in the forums](https://godotdevelopers.org/forum/discussion/17774/automatic-behavior-testing-of-games-in-godot) and I'm making a request in the bug tracker so maybe the devs can keep this under their radar.

> As I software developer, I tend to driven my development of software thought tests to assure the correctness of behavior with the code I'm writing and because this method of software development helps me find bugs when I introduce them by accident during the development process.
> 
> So, I was wondering why Godot have no automatic testing facilities to allow game developers assure the game behaves as they want. I see this feature for Godot not only useful during development, but also afterwards, specially for those authors writing books or making on-line classes on Godot: for them automatically checking what APIs are outdated or which lines of code don't work as they supposed to in new versions of Godot, making it easy to updated their material where it is required. Nowadays is very easy to find outdated code for different programming languages or frameworks, and Godot isn't going to be an exception.

In my my mind, this could consists of:

- a way to simulate player input (touch in screen with finger or mouse pointer, button or key pressed, action triggered)
    - A way to move a node using simulated inputs until the node reach the target point, maybe?
- a way to gather nodes properties after the input is sent and allow value comparison and yell error when the developer see it fit.
- a way to set fixtures and tear down them before and after each test.
- a way to take screenshots between steps of the test.
    - does it makes sense to record a video during each test? I mean, in the gamedev context.
- The tests should be triggered from the command line (say: `godot --test-node nodescene.tscn --test-script mytestscript.gd` or `godot --run-tests` in the current game project directory and let Godot search a folder called "testing" with GDScripts defining the tests).

data.title: Build and play buttons to run multiple instances at once
data.body: It would be helpful for developing multiplayer games if it was possible to instantly build and run a number of instances of the game at once to see if networking works correctly.

data.title: Update README.md
Fix IPv6 linking for UWP
[Proposal] Option for discarding draws outside of a `Control` rectangle
data.body:
This can be use full in some case. Example :

In my game I've got a `GridContainer` which holds a list of `Control`s. Each of these `Control`s have a `Sprite`. I scale each sprite to fill all the `Control` space. But, if the texture does not have the exact aspect ratio of the `Control`, the `Sprite` will draw outside of the `Control`. What I done is to compute the texture region rectangle to have the exact aspect ratio. Even if the logic and the math behind this isn't really hard, it can be a problem to beginners in games development. 

Thanks.

data.title: Linking error for UWP
data.body:
Current master (681575f) fails on the linking phase for UWP build, related to the IPv6 addition. [Q&A post with the error](https://godotengine.org/qa/9507/error-while-trying-to-compile-godot-for-winrt-windows-phone).

```
tcp_server_winsock.winrt.opt.debug.64.x64.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol in6addr_any
packet_peer_udp_winsock.winrt.opt.debug.64.x64.obj : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol in6addr_any
bin\godot.winrt.opt.debug.64.x64.exe : fatal error LNK1120: 1 unresolved externals
scons: *** [bin\godot.winrt.opt.debug.64.x64.exe] Error 1120
scons: building terminated because of errors
```

data.title: Greater VCS friendliness
data.body:
Make `AnimationPlayer` serialize its blend times always sorted so their order is predictable in the **.tscn** file.
Serialize dictionaries adding newlines between key-value pairs.
Serialize group lists also with newlines in between.
Serialize string properties escaping only `"` and `\` (needed for a good diff experience with built-in scripts).

__This PR is back-compat; won't break loading of existing files.__

data.title: Cannot assign a custom color to a label after assigning it a theme
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux, Godot 2.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I assigned a label a custom theme, and then clicked away from the node in the editor. When I came back to the node, the "custom color" section in the inspector was gone. **However, any animations I set up that changed custom color still worked fine**, even though I couldn't see custom color in the inspector anymore.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Make a scene structure like this:
```
Node2D
  Label
```

1.) Create a new theme for Label via inspector
2.) Select another node
3.) Select "label" again -- custom color, etc, unavailable.

Encountered when I tried replicating an arcadey color cycle effect for using AnimationPlayer + a Label's custom color field.

data.title: Fixed Mix nodes in Animation Tree Player
data.body: Fixed a bug introduced by myself in fixing the Animation Tree Player that causes Mix nodes to behave pretty much like blend2 nodes (The weight of each animation was normalized by the total combined weight of all animations) but this shouldn't happen because mix nodes can lead to the combined weight of all the animations to exceed 1.

data.title: Access to processing time and fixed processing time from GDScript
data.body:
Would it be possible to add functions that return "processing" time and "fixed processing" time, which would return the value you would get (in principle, ignoring precision issues) if you added processing or fixed processing deltas to some accumulator every frame. A sort of "engine" time, affected by things like pausing, as opposed to "real" time.  
This would be useful for instance to keep track of cooldowns without active processing, by simply storing the time the cooldown would end in a variable and then comparing that to the current processing time.  
I would guess the engine keeps track of it anyway, so it shouldn't be too hard to simply expose it to GDScript.

data.title: Fix resetting to default value in EditorSettings
data.body:
I tested several ways to fix this problem.
And I found there is nowhere this `save_changed_setting` is setting back to `false` except the line with this PR.

in EditorSettings constructor, `save_changed_setting=true;`
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/tools/editor/editor_settings.cpp#L1076
so, `_load_defaults();` can keep setting for the defaults things.
but after `save_changed_setting=false;` in the end of constructor,
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/tools/editor/editor_settings.cpp#L1101
EditorSettings::create() will not save custom settings.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/tools/editor/editor_node.cpp#L5405

After several tests, I can keep my editor settings now.

Fix #6056
